titleInfo.title: John Johnston -- to Jasper Parrish, 1800 July 19

originInfo.publisher: Online collection published by Vassar College Libraries, Poughkeepsie, N.Y.

physicalDescription.extent: Loose pages (3 p. ); Iron gall ink on aged paper

mods.accessCondition: For more information about rights and reproduction, visit http://specialcollections.vassar.edu/policies/permissionto.html
mods.abstract:
From "Jasper Parrish Papers in Vassar College Library (typed transcript), 1954," p. 44.
[In scrapbook]
Letter to Jasper Parrish at Canandaigua from John Johnston, Geneva, July 19, 1800. Johnston has sent a standard for the Troop via Mr. Morris as a mark of his esteem for the members of the Troop. Johnston is at the command of the Troop but his distance from them prevents him from taking charge; he is planning to resign his commission.

mods.abstract: Letter from Moses Van Campbell at Angelica August 12| 1817 to Jasper Parish asking Parish to make certain banking arrangements for a loan for improving a road in Allegany the bank is the Ontario Bank.
